Dialogue.Page: TRAPPIST-1d is the third planet around the star TRAPPIST-1.
TRAPPIST-1d is a small terrestrial planet orbiting near the middle of TRAPPIST-1's habitable zone.
It receives about 110% the light earth does, putting it just before the middle of the habitable zone.
It also likely contains a significant amount of water, hundreds of times all of Earth's oceans combined, although what state that water is in is hotly debated.
Because of this, it may be a possible candidate for finding extraterrestrial life.
The nature of TRAPPIST-1d's atmosphere is a matter of some debate.
Because of the solar radiation coming off of TRAPPIST-1, many scientists have reason to believe it has a thick, Venus like water vapor atmosphere.
However, this is not certain, and it may also have a compact Earth-like atmosphere like as depicted.
If TRAPPIST-1d has a suitable atmosphere, it's surface is likely entirely covered with a water ocean over a hundred kilometers deep.
It may be uniformly liquid like as depicted, or it could be frozen on the night side, depending on how the atmosphere is able to distribute heat.
Regardless, the water near the seafloor may be very warm due to tidal hearing from the nearby planets.
TRAPPIST-1d is a good candidate for finding extraterrestrial life due to the amount of light it receives and large amount of water.
However, whether it actually has life is probably impossible to determine with our current technology.
It would certainly have a lot to overcome,
some scientists believe that life may never form on ocean planets due to the lack of tidal zones.
Other's believe the reddish, mostly infrared light coming from TRAPPIST-1 may make photosynthesis difficult.
